DISEASE: Convulsions, Familial Infantile, With Paroxysmal Choreoathetosis
RECORD:
Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Convulsions, Familial Infantile, With Paroxysmal Choreoathetosis present clinical features that include seizures, ataxia, choreoathetosis, and developmental delay.

Genetic analysis of the CACNA1A gene has revealed a heterozygous mutation in a patient with Convulsions, Familial Infantile, With Paroxysmal Choreoathetosis.
